meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unsteady.
meanings.sent1: Her unsteadinesses made it difficult for her to walk in a straight line.
meanings.sent2: The boat rocked back and forth, showing its unsteadinesses on the rough sea.
meanings.sent3: The unsteadinesses of the table made the cups dance a little jig.
meanings.sent4: His unsteadinesses in decision-making caused chaos in the team.
meanings.sent5: The unsteadinesses of the old bridge made crossing it a nerve-wracking experience.

meanings.sent1: The unsteadinesses of the chair made it unsafe to sit on.
meanings.sent2: The unsteadinesses of the economy caused uncertainty among investors.
meanings.sent3: The unsteadinesses of the ladder made climbing it a risky endeavor.
meanings.sent4: The unsteadinesses of his voice revealed his nervousness.
meanings.sent5: The unsteadinesses of the ground beneath them made them stumble and fall.

meanings.sent1: The unsteadinesses in her story made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent2: His unsteadinesses in his opinions made it challenging to trust his judgment.
meanings.sent3: The unsteadinesses in the weather made planning a picnic a gamble.
meanings.sent4: The unsteadinesses in his commitment showed his lack of dedication.
meanings.sent5: The unsteadinesses in her grades reflected her lack of focus in class.
